zh.title: Basic Greetings
zh.description: Learn how to say hello, goodbye, and introduce yourself in Chinese

activities.title: Introduction to Basic Greetings
activities.content:
Welcome to your first Chinese lesson! Let's learn the most essential greetings.

📚 Basic Vocabulary:

你好 (nǐ hǎo) - Hello
This is the most common greeting in Chinese, used at any time of day.

再见 (zài jiàn) - Goodbye
Use this when parting ways with someone.

早上好 (zǎo shang hǎo) - Good morning
A polite morning greeting, literally means 'morning good.'

Let's practice these greetings!

activities.question: What does 你好 mean in English?
activities.explanation: 你好 (nǐ hǎo) is the most common way to say hello in Chinese. It's used in both formal and informal situations.

activities.question: What does 再见 mean?
activities.explanation: 再见 (zài jiàn) means goodbye. Literally, it means 'see again,' expressing the hope to meet again.

activities.question: What does 早上好 mean?
activities.explanation: 早上好 (zǎo shang hǎo) is used to greet someone in the morning. 早上 means 'morning' and 好 means 'good.'

activities.title: Asking How Someone Is
activities.content:
Now let's learn how to ask someone how they are doing.

你好吗？ (nǐ hǎo ma?) - How are you?
This is formed by adding 吗 (ma) to 你好, turning it into a question.

💡 Common responses:
• 很好 (hěn hǎo) - Very good/I'm fine
• 不错 (bù cuò) - Not bad/Pretty good
• 还好 (hái hǎo) - Okay/So-so

Remember: Adding 吗 (ma) to the end of a statement turns it into a yes/no question!

activities.question: How do you ask 'How are you?' in Chinese?
activities.explanation: 你好吗？ (nǐ hǎo ma?) means 'How are you?' The 吗 (ma) particle at the end makes it a question.

activities.title: Introducing Yourself
activities.content:
Let's learn how to introduce yourself in Chinese.

我叫 (wǒ jiào) - My name is... / I am called...

Structure:
我 (wǒ) = I/me
叫 (jiào) = to be called

Example:
我叫李明。(Wǒ jiào Lǐ Míng.) - My name is Li Ming.
我叫Sarah。(Wǒ jiào Sarah.) - My name is Sarah.

🎯 You can use 我叫 with any name, whether Chinese or foreign!

activities.question: Translate to Chinese: 'My name is...'
activities.explanation: 我叫 (wǒ jiào) is how you introduce yourself in Chinese. It literally means 'I am called.'

activities.title: Asking Someone's Name
activities.content:
Now you know how to introduce yourself. Let's learn how to ask someone their name.

你叫什么名字？ (Nǐ jiào shén me míng zi?) - What is your name?

Breaking it down:
• 你 (nǐ) = you
• 叫 (jiào) = to be called
• 什么 (shén me) = what
• 名字 (míng zi) = name

💬 Complete exchange:
A: 你好！你叫什么名字？ (Hello! What's your name?)
B: 我叫王芳。你呢？ (My name is Wang Fang. And you?)
A: 我叫Tom。很高兴认识你！ (I'm Tom. Nice to meet you!)

activities.question: Write in Chinese: 'What is your name?'
activities.hint: Uses 你 (you), 叫 (called), 什么 (what), 名字 (name)
activities.explanation: 你叫什么名字？ is how you ask someone their name in Chinese.

activities.title: Putting It All Together
activities.content:
Great work! Let's review everything you've learned:

✅ Greetings:
• 你好 (nǐ hǎo) - Hello
• 早上好 (zǎo shang hǎo) - Good morning
• 再见 (zài jiàn) - Goodbye

✅ Questions:
• 你好吗？ (nǐ hǎo ma?) - How are you?
• 你叫什么名字？ (Nǐ jiào shén me míng zi?) - What's your name?

✅ Introduction:
• 我叫... (wǒ jiào...) - My name is...

✅ Bonus phrases:
• 很高兴认识你 (hěn gāo xìng rèn shi nǐ) - Nice to meet you

You now have all the basics to have a polite greeting conversation in Chinese!

activities.question: Which phrase means 'Nice to meet you' in Chinese?
activities.explanation: 很高兴认识你 (hěn gāo xìng rèn shi nǐ) means 'Nice to meet you.' It's commonly used when meeting someone for the first time.

zh.title: Numbers 1-20
zh.description: Learn to count from 1 to 20 in Chinese

activities.title: Introduction to Chinese Numbers
activities.content:
Welcome to Chinese numbers! Chinese counting is actually quite logical once you understand the pattern.

🔢 Numbers 1-10:
一 (yī) - 1
二 (èr) - 2
三 (sān) - 3
四 (sì) - 4
五 (wǔ) - 5
六 (liù) - 6
七 (qī) - 7
八 (bā) - 8
九 (jiǔ) - 9
十 (shí) - 10

💡 Fun fact: The character 三 (3) has three horizontal lines, and 二 (2) has two!

activities.question: What number does 三 represent?
activities.explanation: 三 (sān) is the Chinese character for 3. Notice it has three horizontal lines!

activities.question: What does 一 mean in English?
activities.explanation: 一 (yī) means one in Chinese. It's a single horizontal stroke.

activities.question: Write the Chinese character for the number 5.
activities.hint: Has two horizontal lines with other strokes
activities.explanation: 五 (wǔ) is the Chinese character for 5.

activities.question: Write the Chinese character for 10.
activities.explanation: 十 (shí) means ten in Chinese. It looks like a cross or plus sign.

activities.question: Which number comes after 九 (nine)?
activities.explanation: 十 (shí) means 10, and comes after 9.

activities.title: Numbers 11-19: The Pattern
activities.content:
Here's where Chinese numbers get clever! Numbers 11-19 follow a simple pattern:

十 (10) + [number] = 10 + that number

十一 (shí yī) - 11 (literally 'ten one')
十二 (shí èr) - 12 (literally 'ten two')
十三 (shí sān) - 13 (literally 'ten three')
十四 (shí sì) - 14 (literally 'ten four')
十五 (shí wǔ) - 15 (literally 'ten five')
十六 (shí liù) - 16 (literally 'ten six')
十七 (shí qī) - 17 (literally 'ten seven')
十八 (shí bā) - 18 (literally 'ten eight')
十九 (shí jiǔ) - 19 (literally 'ten nine')

🎯 Just combine 十 with the single digits!

activities.question: What does 十五 mean?
activities.explanation: 十五 (shí wǔ) means 15. It's literally 'ten five' (10 + 5).

activities.question: Write the Chinese characters for the number 12.
activities.explanation: 十二 (shí èr) means 12. It follows the pattern of 十 (ten) + 二 (two).

activities.question: How do you write 18 in Chinese?
activities.explanation: 十八 (shí bā) means 18. It's 十 (ten) plus 八 (eight).

activities.title: Number 20 and Beyond
activities.content:
Now let's learn 20!

二十 (èr shí) - 20 (literally 'two ten')

🔢 Pattern for multiples of 10:
• 二十 (èr shí) - 20 (two tens)
• 三十 (sān shí) - 30 (three tens)
• 四十 (sì shí) - 40 (four tens)
• 五十 (wǔ shí) - 50 (five tens)

💡 The pattern is: [number] + 十 = that number × 10

For numbers like 21, 22, etc., you combine:
二十一 (èr shí yī) - 21 (two tens and one)
二十二 (èr shí èr) - 22 (two tens and two)

Chinese numbers are very systematic!

activities.question: What does 二十 mean?
activities.explanation: 二十 (èr shí) means 20. It's literally 'two tens' (2 × 10).

activities.question: Write the Chinese characters for 17.
activities.explanation: 十七 (shí qī) is 17. It follows the pattern of 十 (ten) + 七 (seven).

activities.title: Review: All Numbers 1-20
activities.content:
Excellent work! Here's your complete reference:

1-10:
一(1) 二(2) 三(3) 四(4) 五(5) 六(6) 七(7) 八(8) 九(9) 十(10)

11-19:
十一(11) 十二(12) 十三(13) 十四(14) 十五(15)
十六(16) 十七(17) 十八(18) 十九(19)

20:
二十(20)

✅ Key patterns:
• 11-19: 十 + single digit
• 20: 二 + 十

You now know how to count to 20 in Chinese! 🎉

activities.question: Which character represents the number 6?
activities.explanation: 六 (liù) is the Chinese character for 6.

zh.title: Colors
zh.description: Learn the names of common colors in Chinese

activities.title: Introduction to Colors
activities.content:
Let's learn the basic colors in Chinese! In Chinese, most colors end with 色 (sè), which means 'color.'

🎨 Basic Colors:

红色 (hóng sè) - Red 🔴
蓝色 (lán sè) - Blue 🔵
绿色 (lǜ sè) - Green 🟢
黄色 (huáng sè) - Yellow 🟡
黑色 (hēi sè) - Black ⚫
白色 (bái sè) - White ⚪

💡 Tip: The first character is the color root, and 色 is added to make it a full color word.

activities.question: What color is 红色?
activities.explanation: 红色 (hóng sè) means red in Chinese. 红 means red, and 色 means color.

activities.question: What does 蓝色 mean?
activities.explanation: 蓝色 (lán sè) means blue in Chinese.

activities.question: Write the Chinese word for 'blue'.
activities.explanation: 蓝色 (lán sè) means blue. Remember, 色 means color!

activities.question: What does 黄色 mean?
activities.explanation: 黄色 (huáng sè) means yellow in Chinese.

activities.question: Write the Chinese word for 'green'.
activities.hint: Same root as the word for 'leaf'
activities.explanation: 绿色 (lǜ sè) means green. The character 绿 is also used in words related to plants and nature.

activities.title: Black and White
activities.content:
Let's focus on black and white, two fundamental colors:

黑色 (hēi sè) - Black ⚫
白色 (bái sè) - White ⚪

🌓 Cultural note:
In Chinese culture, these colors have special meanings:
• 白色 (white) - Associated with purity and mourning
• 黑色 (black) - Can represent mystery or formality

📝 Common uses:
• 黑色的鞋 (hēi sè de xié) - black shoes
• 白色的纸 (bái sè de zhǐ) - white paper

activities.question: What color is 黑色?
activities.explanation: 黑色 (hēi sè) means black in Chinese.

activities.question: Write the Chinese word for 'white'.
activities.explanation: 白色 (bái sè) means white in Chinese.

activities.title: Using Colors in Sentences
activities.content:
Now let's learn how to use colors to describe things!

📝 Pattern: [Object] + 是 + [Color] + 的
是 (shì) = is/am/are
的 (de) = possessive/descriptive particle

Examples:
天空是蓝色的。(Tiān kōng shì lán sè de.)
= The sky is blue.

苹果是红色的。(Píng guǒ shì hóng sè de.)
= The apple is red.

草是绿色的。(Cǎo shì lǜ sè de.)
= The grass is green.

💡 The 的 at the end makes it descriptive!

activities.question: Complete: '天空是____的。' (The sky is blue)
activities.explanation: The sky is blue — '天空是蓝色的'。天空 (tiān kōng) means sky, and 蓝色 (lán sè) means blue.

activities.question: What does '苹果是红色的' mean?
activities.explanation: '苹果是红色的' means 'The apple is red.' 苹果 (píng guǒ) = apple, 是 (shì) = is, 红色 (hóng sè) = red.

activities.title: Color Review
activities.content:
Great job! Let's review all the colors you've learned:

🎨 Complete Color List:
• 红色 (hóng sè) - Red 🔴
• 蓝色 (lán sè) - Blue 🔵
• 绿色 (lǜ sè) - Green 🟢
• 黄色 (huáng sè) - Yellow 🟡
• 黑色 (hēi sè) - Black ⚫
• 白色 (bái sè) - White ⚪

✅ Sentence Pattern:
[Object] + 是 + [Color] + 的

Example: 花是黄色的。(The flower is yellow.)

You now know all six basic colors! 🌈

activities.question: Write the Chinese word for 'red'.
activities.explanation: 红色 (hóng sè) means red in Chinese.

zh.title: Family Members
zh.description: Learn vocabulary for family and relatives in Chinese

activities.title: Introduction to Family Terms
activities.content:
Welcome! Let's learn how to talk about family in Chinese. Chinese family terms are more specific than English.

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Parents:
妈妈 (mā ma) - Mother/Mom
爸爸 (bà ba) - Father/Dad

💡 Notice: Both words repeat the character twice! This makes them easier to remember and adds affection.

📝 Usage:
我的妈妈 (wǒ de mā ma) - My mother
我的爸爸 (wǒ de bà ba) - My father

Let's practice these important words!

activities.question: What does 妈妈 mean?
activities.explanation: 妈妈 (mā ma) means mother. Both characters are the same, making it easy to remember!

activities.question: What does 爸爸 mean?
activities.explanation: 爸爸 (bà ba) means father. Like 妈妈, it repeats the same character twice.

activities.title: Siblings - Older Brothers and Sisters
activities.content:
In Chinese, there are different words for older and younger siblings!

👦 Older Siblings:
哥哥 (gē ge) - Older brother
姐姐 (jiě jie) - Older sister

⚠️ Important: These specifically mean OLDER siblings (born before you).

📝 Examples:
我有一个哥哥。(Wǒ yǒu yī gè gē ge.)
= I have one older brother.

我的姐姐很好。(Wǒ de jiě jie hěn hǎo.)
= My older sister is very nice.

This specificity helps everyone understand the family structure clearly!

activities.question: Write the Chinese word for 'older brother'.
activities.explanation: 哥哥 (gē ge) means older brother. Both characters are the same!

activities.question: What does 姐姐 mean?
activities.explanation: 姐姐 (jiě jie) means older sister - a sister who is older than you.

activities.title: Younger Siblings
activities.content:
Now let's learn the words for younger siblings:

👶 Younger Siblings:
弟弟 (dì di) - Younger brother
妹妹 (mèi mei) - Younger sister

🔑 Key difference:
• 哥哥/姐姐 = OLDER siblings
• 弟弟/妹妹 = YOUNGER siblings

📝 Examples:
我有一个弟弟。(Wǒ yǒu yī gè dì di.)
= I have one younger brother.

我的妹妹五岁。(Wǒ de mèi mei wǔ suì.)
= My younger sister is 5 years old.

💡 This system helps clarify birth order in the family!

activities.question: Complete: '我有两个____。' (I have two older brothers)
activities.explanation: 哥哥 (gē ge) means older brother. The sentence means 'I have two older brothers.'

activities.question: Write the Chinese word for 'younger sister'.
activities.hint: Two identical characters, starts with 妹
activities.explanation: 妹妹 (mèi mei) means younger sister - a sister younger than you.

activities.title: Grandparents
activities.content:
Let's learn how to say grandmother and grandfather:

👴👵 Grandparents:
奶奶 (nǎi nai) - Grandmother (father's side)
爷爷 (yé ye) - Grandfather (father's side)

📝 Note: These specifically refer to paternal grandparents (your father's parents). There are different words for maternal grandparents!

💭 Usage:
我的奶奶 (wǒ de nǎi nai) - My grandmother
我的爷爷 (wǒ de yé ye) - My grandfather

Examples:
我爱我的奶奶。(Wǒ ài wǒ de nǎi nai.)
= I love my grandmother.

爷爷很高。(Yé ye hěn gāo.)
= Grandfather is very tall.

activities.question: What does 奶奶 mean?
activities.explanation: 奶奶 (nǎi nai) means grandmother, specifically on your father's side of the family.

activities.question: What does 爷爷 mean?
activities.explanation: 爷爷 (yé ye) means grandfather, specifically your father's father.

activities.title: Family Phrases and Review
activities.content:
Let's learn some useful family phrases and review!

📝 Useful Phrases:
这是我的家人。(Zhè shì wǒ de jiā rén.)
= This is my family.

我有一个大家庭。(Wǒ yǒu yī gè dà jiā tíng.)
= I have a big family.

我爱我的家人。(Wǒ ài wǒ de jiā rén.)
= I love my family.

✅ Complete Family Vocabulary:
• 妈妈 (mā ma) - Mother
• 爸爸 (bà ba) - Father
• 哥哥 (gē ge) - Older brother
• 姐姐 (jiě jie) - Older sister
• 弟弟 (dì di) - Younger brother
• 妹妹 (mèi mei) - Younger sister
• 奶奶 (nǎi nai) - Grandmother
• 爷爷 (yé ye) - Grandfather

You now know all the essential family terms! 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦

activities.question: What does '这是我的家人' mean?
activities.explanation: '这是我的家人' means 'This is my family.' 这是 = this is, 我的 = my, 家人 = family.

activities.question: Write the Chinese word for 'grandfather'.
activities.explanation: 爷爷 (yé ye) means grandfather (on your father's side).
